output_list.reason: The mintToken function does not have a check to prevent overflow of the total supply. An attacker can mint tokens to an arbitrary user account, causing an integer overflow and granting disproportionate access to the attacker.

The sell function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the revenue calculation, allowing a seller to sell a large amount of tokens, causing a large revenue value, and subsequently causing an integer overflow in the seller's balance, granting disproportionate access to the attacker.

The transfer function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the amount check, allowing a sender to transfer a large amount of tokens, causing a large balance value, and subsequently causing an integer overflow in the sender's balance, granting disproportionate access to the attacker.

The buy function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the amount calculation, allowing a buyer to buy a large amount of tokens, causing a large amount value, and subsequently causing an integer overflow in the buyer's balance, granting disproportionate access to the attacker.

The setPrices function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the buyPrice and sellPrice assignment, allowing a malicious owner to set these prices to a large value, and subsequently causing an integer overflow in the buyer's and seller's balances, granting disproportionate access to the attacker.
